page.title: 09THE VICAR'S DAY IN ANLABY
page.content: After rising at 7.15 a.m. the vicar begins work at 8.15. Today he spends an hour delivering leaflets and talking to parishioners he meets. Between 9.15 and 1 p.m. he holds a Bible study group at the vicarage, prepares a sermon, takes morning communion and deals with the mail. After lunch,1-2p.m.,he joins the members of the over-60's club. The rest of the afternoon is spent visiting parishioners and people who have left but want to maintain contact.Tea,at 6 p.m.,is followed by choir practice. Visits are made in the evening to those needing comfort - a sick child, a bereaved lady. At 8 p.m. is another Bible study and prayer group. By 10 p.m. it's time to unwind - the paper is read and letters are written. At 10.30 the vicar retires to bed.
